oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hamilton Love
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Portrait of Hamilton Love, seated, wearing top hat and tails. See also #2564.

Henry Hamilton Love (1875-1922) was a partner in Love, Boyd & Co., wholesale lumber. He married Bessie Mai Davis in Dec. 1901. He was chair of the Nashville board of censorship of moving pictures. He died on 5/2/1922 and his death certificate lists the cause of death as: ""Revolver wound of chest - Suicidal.""
